Nobody's about to book a trip to Egypt right now.`` The United States really needs stability there, Patrick Leahy continued,`` because of our interests in Israel and Jordan and elsewhere.'' Sen. Officially, Mr. Paul Bremer reported to Mr. Donald Rumsfeld . But he viewed himself as the president's man, had a background in the State Department, and a relationship with Condoleezza Rice , says Mr. Donald Rumsfeld . So Mr. Paul Bremer chose what guidance he preferred, which Mr. Donald Rumsfeld describes as the equivalent of having`` four or eight hands on the steering wheel.'' DC- In a surprise shakeup, Google co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the search giant. Starting April 4, Page will take over day-to-day operations while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Shortly after the announcement was posted on the company's blog, Eric Schmidt tweeted`` Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!'' in reference to his much-discussed role as a moderating check to Page

Dick Cheney made a surprise appearance Thursday at the Conservative Political Action Committee Convention to present the former two-time defense secretary an award. The vice president joked that Donald Rumsfeld twice served as defense secretary and added that maybe if we give him a third term, he might get it right. Dick Cheney also drew laughs when he wondered aloud if Donald Rumsfeld may have more influence on Mr. Barack Obama than the president's current advisers. Mr. Barack Obama campaigned against the Bush White House's national security policies

the command of George H.W. Bush 's son, President Bush . Another view on war's end The journal Foreign Policy also questions whether the war truly was successful. Memories of Desert Storm In ending the war unilaterally before Saddam Hussein had been chastened, the George H.W. Bush administration condemned the United States to a long-term presence in the Gulf in an effort to contain Iraq. This presence, and the sanctions imposed on Iraq due to Saddam Hussein 's recalcitrance, in the end served as a rallying cry for jihadists such as Osama Bin Laden against the United States and its friends in the region. Colin Powell , chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff under the first George H.W. Bush and secretary of state under the second, was among officials gathered with the elder George H.W. Bush at a symposium last week to discuss the war
